name: Beef and Green Pepper Stir Fry (Chinjao Rosu)
description: Beef and Green Pepper Stir Fry (Chinjao Rosu) is an extremely popular dish in Japan—so much so that we have our own version! This a one-pan stir-fry full of flavor that comes together in less than 30 minutes.
recipeIngredient: ½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye)
½  green bell pepper ((5 oz, 150 g with seeds))

recipeInstructions.name: To Make the Marinade and Sauce

itemListElement.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the marinade ingredients: 2 tsp soy sauce, 2 tsp sake, 1 tsp toasted sesame oil, 1 tsp potato starch or cornstarch, and freshly ground black pepper). Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a medium bowl, whisk together the marinade ingredients: 2 tsp soy sauce, 2 tsp sake, 1 tsp toasted sesame oil, 1 tsp potato starch or cornstarch, and freshly ground black pepper). Set aside.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, whisk together the sauce ingredients: 1½ Tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sugar, 2 tsp oyster sauce, 1 Tbsp sake, 2 Tbsp chicken stock/broth, and 1 tsp potato starch or cornstarch. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, whisk together the sauce ingredients: 1½ Tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sugar, 2 tsp oyster sauce, 1 Tbsp sake, 2 Tbsp chicken stock/broth, and 1 tsp potato starch or cornstarch. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Slice ½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye) into thin strips (make sure to cut against the grain). Here, I use pre-sliced sukiyaki beef and cut it into strips. Sukiyaki beef is slightly thicker than shabu shabu beef.
itemListElement.name: Slice ½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye) into thin strips (make sure to cut against the grain). Here, I use pre-sliced sukiyaki beef and cut it into strips. Sukiyaki beef is slightly thicker than shabu shabu beef.

itemListElement.text: Add the beef into the marinade and coat well using your hands. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Add the beef into the marinade and coat well using your hands. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Cut ½ green bell pepper into thin strips. If your bell pepper is tall, cut the strips in half widthwise.
itemListElement.name: Cut ½ green bell pepper into thin strips. If your bell pepper is tall, cut the strips in half widthwise.

itemListElement.text: Cut ½ bamboo shoot into thin strips, similar in size to the beef and bell pepper. If the bamboo shoot is too long, cut in half widthwise. Find the best way to cut it into thin equal-length strips. Here, I cut into thin slabs first.
itemListElement.name: Cut ½ bamboo shoot into thin strips, similar in size to the beef and bell pepper. If the bamboo shoot is too long, cut in half widthwise. Find the best way to cut it into thin equal-length strips. Here, I cut into thin slabs first.

itemListElement.text: The bamboo shoot has a hollow inside, and it’s hard to cut it into all uniform strips, but do your best.
itemListElement.name: The bamboo shoot has a hollow inside, and it’s hard to cut it into all uniform strips, but do your best.

itemListElement.text: Mince 1 knob ginger and crush or press 2 cloves garlic.
itemListElement.name: Mince 1 knob ginger and crush or press 2 cloves garlic.

itemListElement.text: Heat the wok on medium-high heat, and when it’s hot, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil and coat the wok well with oil.
itemListElement.name: Heat the wok on medium-high heat, and when it’s hot, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil and coat the wok well with oil.

itemListElement.text: Add the green pepper and stir-fry for 5 minutes or until slightly tender. The bamboo shoot is pre-boiled, so it is not necessary to cook for a long time. Therefore, make sure to cook the green pepper properly at this stage.
itemListElement.name: Add the green pepper and stir-fry for 5 minutes or until slightly tender. The bamboo shoot is pre-boiled, so it is not necessary to cook for a long time. Therefore, make sure to cook the green pepper properly at this stage.

itemListElement.text: Add the bamboo shoot and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes, or until tender. Turn off the heat, and transfer to a plate.
itemListElement.name: Add the bamboo shoot and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes, or until tender. Turn off the heat, and transfer to a plate.

itemListElement.text: Turn the heat back on to medium, and add 1 Tbsp neutral oil, the minced ginger, and the garlic. Stir-fry until fragrant.
itemListElement.name: Turn the heat back on to medium, and add 1 Tbsp neutral oil, the minced ginger, and the garlic. Stir-fry until fragrant.

itemListElement.text: Add the beef, and stir-fry until it‘s almost no longer pink.
itemListElement.name: Add the beef, and stir-fry until it‘s almost no longer pink.

itemListElement.text: Add the stir-fried vegetables back into the wok, and stir-fry everything to combine.
itemListElement.name: Add the stir-fried vegetables back into the wok, and stir-fry everything to combine.

itemListElement.text: Whisk and pour the sauce over the meat and veggies. The starch in the sauce will thicken as it is heated, so quickly toss everything together one last time.
itemListElement.name: Whisk and pour the sauce over the meat and veggies. The starch in the sauce will thicken as it is heated, so quickly toss everything together one last time.

itemListElement.text: Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Serve with steamed rice and enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Serve with steamed rice and enjoy!

itemListElement.text: You can store the leftover in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3–4 days.
itemListElement.name: You can store the leftover in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3–4 days.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! Quick and easy to make too!
I am not able to eat oyster sauce....any substitutes?  Love your website!

BEEF AND GREEN PEPPER STIR FRY. I made a similar dish last night, but I added New Mexico Peppers to it. Very good. The best part is168 Mkt. has bamboo shoots in the raw form & now I know how to prepare & use them.
